result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodrick Cornelius Stewart

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Rodrick Cornelius Stewart.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently court appointed on defendant's other case and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Golden to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of$50.00 per month beginning at the conclusion of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant requests additional time to hire private counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Remaining cash bail to return to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANW, RS Jr. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
